result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

SIGNATURE BOND CONDITIONS MODIFIED

Court reporter Paige Reardon. Attorney Andrea N Winder in court for David R Johannsen.  Attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Winder motions to modify the defendants bail condition of not being in the 7900 block of Old Sauk Pass Rd in Cross Plains. The state does not object. Court grants defendants motion. The geographic restriction "Defendant shall not be in the 7900 block of Old Sauk Pass Rd in Cross Plains" is removed as a bond condition. ALL OTHER BOND CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

Court reporter Paige Reardon. Defendant David R Johannsen in court.  Attorney Andrea N Winder in court for David R Johannsen.  Attorney Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. State motions to orally amend count 1 to misdemeanor battery 940.19(1). Court grants the states motion. Def entered a plea of guilty to amended count 1, and count 2.  Court 3 is dismissed. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail continued.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

03:36 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
